alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 5:10AM PST until January 11 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches for valley locations, and 12 to 18 inches generally west of US-395. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 50 mph in valley locations, with gusts up to 70 mph in wind prone areas such as US-395, and 100 to 120 mph along Sierra ridges. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the afternoon-evening commute today, with icy or snow covered roads continuing through the Thursday morning commute. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be found by checking with CalTrans.
